FERMENTABLE.NAME: Clear Candi Sugar
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Crystalized candi sugar for use in Tripels, Dubbels, and holiday ales.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Sucrose
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: A sugar used to increase starting gravity.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Mild Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Also called 'English Mild' - a light specialty malt used in Brown Ales.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pilsner (2 Row) - Belgium
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Belgian base malt for Continental lagers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat, Flaked
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Flaked wheat adds to increased body and foam retention. May be used in small amounts to improve head retention and body.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Biscuit Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Use for English ales, brown ales and porters. Adds a biscuit like flavor and aroma. Can be used as a substitute for toasted malt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Grits
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Imparts a corn and grain taste.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Carared
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds body, color and improves head retention.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Oats, Flaked
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds body, mouth feel and head retention to the beer. Adds substantial protein haze to light beers. Protein rest recommended unless flakes are pre-gelatinized.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caraamber
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds body, color and improves head retention.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pale Malt (2 Row) - Belgium
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Base malt for all beer styles.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Cane Sugar
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Common, household sugar used to lighten the flavor and body.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Special B Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Extreme caramel aroma and flavored malt. Used in dark Belgian Abbey and Trappist ales.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Barley, Raw
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Raw, unmalted barley can be used to add body to your beer. Use in homebrew requires very fine milling combined with a decoction or multi-stage mash. Performs best when used in small quantities with well modified grains.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Special Roast
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Use for English ales, nut brown ales and porters. Adds a toasted, biscuit like flavor and aroma.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Lactose
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: A partially fermentable sugar that adds lasting sweetness.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Light Dry Extract
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: For general-purpose use in light beers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Beet Sugar
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Common, household sugar used to lighten the flavor and body.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat Malt - Belgium
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Malted wheat for use in Wheat beers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: White Wheat Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: White wheat gives a malty flavor not available from raw wheat.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Black Barley (Stout)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Unmalted barley roasted at high temperature to create a dry, coffee like flavor. Imparts a sharp acrid flavor characteristic of dry stouts. Gives dryness to a stout or porter.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Victory Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Toasted malt that adds a Biscuit or toasted flavor to English ales.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Rye, Flaked
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Imparts a dry, crisp rye flavor to rye beers. Can be easier to mash than raw rye.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Chocolate Malt (UK)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Dark malt that gives a rich red or brown color and nutty flavor. Maintains some malty flavor, not as dark as roasted malt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Black (Patent) Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Dark color and dry roasted flavor characteristic of Stouts and Porters. Used for: Coloring in small amounts, or flavoring of Stouts and Porters in larger amounts.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Dark Dry Extract
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: For general-purpose use in darker beers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Belgian Candi Syrup - 45L
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Crystalized candi sugar for use in Tripels, Dubbels, and holiday ales.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Chocolate Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Dark malt that gives a rich red or brown color and nutty flavor. Maintains some malty flavor, not as dark as roasted malt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramunich Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Caramel, copper colored malt. Used in Belgian ales and German bocks.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Munich Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Malty-sweet flavor characteristic and adds a reddish amber color to the beer. Does not contribute significantly to body or head retention.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel/Crystal Malt - 10L
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds body, color and improves head retention.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Rye Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds a dry, crisp character to the beer. Yields a deep red color, and a distinctive rye flavor.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Barley, Flaked
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds significant body to Porters and Stouts. High haze producing protein prevents use in light beers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel/Crystal Malt - 120L
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds body, color and improves head retention.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat, Roasted
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Also called Chocolate Wheat Malt. Adds a deep, dark brown color to dunkelweizens and other dark beer styles.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel/Crystal Malt - 20L
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds body, color and improves head retention.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pale Liquid Extract
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: For general-purpose use in light and pale beers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat Dry Extract
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Wheat extract for general-purpose use in wheat beers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel/Crystal Malt - 60L
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds body, color and improves head retention.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel/Crystal Malt - 140L
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds body, color and improves head retention.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Aromatic Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Provides a very strong malt flavor and aroma to your beer.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Corn Syrup
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Syrup derived from corn sugar.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel/Crystal Malt - 40L
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds body, color and improves head retention.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Roasted Barley
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Roasted at high temperature to create a burnt, grainy, coffee like flavor. Imparts a red to deep brown color to beer, and very strong roasted flavor.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Dextrose
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Common bottling sugar.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Melanoiden Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Aromatic malt from Banberg, Germany. Promotes a full flavor and rounds off beer color. Promotes deep red color and malty flavor.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel/Crystal Malt - 30L
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds body, color and improves head retention.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pilsner Liquid Extract
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: For general-purpose use in pale beers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat, Torrified
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Unmodified wheat that has been popped to open the kernels. Protein rest recommended when mashing.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Corn (Flaked)
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Generally a neutral flavor, used to reduce maltiness of beer.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Brown Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Imparts a dry, biscuit flavor. Used in nut brown ales, porters and some Belgian ales.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Munich Malt - 10L
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Malty-sweet flavor characteristic and adds a slight orange color to the beer.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Peat Smoked Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Robust smoky malt that provides a smoky flavor. Used in scottish ales and wee heavy ales.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pale Malt (6 Row) - USA
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Base malt for all beer styles.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pilsner (2 Row) - Germany
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: German base for Pilsners and Bohemian Lagers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pilsner (2 Row) - UK
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Pilsner base malt.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Table Sugar
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: A sugar used to increase starting gravity.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Munich Malt - 20L
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Malty-sweet flavor characteristic and adds a orange to deep orange color to the beer.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Oats, Malted
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Malted oats. Adds body, mouth feel and head retention to the beer. Creates chill haze in lighter beers, so is primarily used in dark ones.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Amber Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Roasted specialty malt used in some English browns, milds and old ales to add color and a biscuit taste. Intense flavor - so limit use. Low diastatic power so must be mashed with well modified malts.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pale Malt (2 Row) - USA
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Base malt for all beer styles.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Sorghum Syrup
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: A gluten-free extract based on sorghum grain. Can be used as a substitute for Light Malt Extract.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pale Malt (2 Row) - UK
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Base malt for all English beer styles.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat Liquid Extract
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Wheat/barley extract for general-purpose use in wheat beers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Smoked Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Malt that has been smoked over an open fire. Creates a distinctive smoke flavor and aroma.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Rice Hulls
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Neutral hulls used to improve lautering.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Molasses
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: A strong, dark, and sweet sugar.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Barley Hulls
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Neutral hulls used to improve lautering.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Cara-Pils/Dextrine
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Significantly increases foam/head retention and body of the beer.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Rice Extract Syrup
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Used like other rice adjuncts in American and Japanese lagers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Amber Dry Extract
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Amber colored dry malt extract for general purpose use.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Rye Liquid Extract
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Mixed rye/barley extract for general-purpose brewing.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel/Crystal Malt - 160L
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds body, color and improves head retention.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Brumalt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Dark German malt developed to add malt flavor of Alt, Marzen and Oktoberfest beers. Helps create authentic maltiness without having to do a decoction mash.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Honey
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Used for light flavor and body. Can be added to primary fermentation, but must be pasteurized.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat Malt - Germany
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Malted wheat base for use in all wheat styles.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Belgian Candi Syrup - 180L
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Crystalized candi sugar for use in Tripels, Dubbels, and holiday ales.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Dark Liquid Extract
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: For general-purpose use in darker beers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Milk Sugar
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: A partially fermentable sugar that adds lasting sweetness.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caravienne Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Light Belgian crystal malt. Used in light Trappist and Abbey style Belgian ales.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Amber Liquid Extract
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Amber colored liquid malt extract for general purpose use.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: CaraFoam
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Significantly increases foam/head retention and body of the beer.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Demerara Sugar
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: A dark, unrefined sugar that contains molasses.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Dextrine
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Significantly increases foam/head retention and body of the beer.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Vienna Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Kiln dried malt darker than Pale Malt, but not as dark as Munich Malt. Imparts a golden to orange color to the beer.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel/Crystal Malt - 80L
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds body, color and improves head retention.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Turbinado
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: A light, raw brown sugar used to increase starting gravity.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Corn Sugar
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Common bottling sugar.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Invert Sugar
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: A sugar used to increase starting gravity.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Toasted Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Similar to Biscuit or Victory malt, this malt adds reddish/orange color and improved body without sweetness along with a toasted flavor.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Dark Brown Sugar
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Imparts a sweet, rich flavor.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Belgian Candi Syrup - 90L
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Crystalized candi sugar for use in Tripels, Dubbels, and holiday ales.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Light Brown Sugar
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Imparts a sweet, rich flavor.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Rice, Flaked
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Used to add fermentable sugar without increasing body. Produces a milder, less grainy tasting beer.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel/Crystal Malt - 90L
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds body, color and improves head retention.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Barley, Torrefied
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Raw barley that has been popped to open the kernels. Used in place of raw barley for faster conversion and higher yields. High in haze producing protein.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Maple Syrup
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: If added during the boil it will add a dry, woodsy flavor. If added at bottling, the smooth maple flavor comes through.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Acid Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Acid malt contains acids from natural lactic acids. Used by German brewers to adjust malt PH without chemicals to adhere to German purity laws. Also enhances the head retention.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Maris Otter Pale Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: A base malt from the UK.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Extra Light Dry Extract
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: For general-purpose use in light and very light beers.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Dark Wheat Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Dark malted wheat base for use in dark wheat styles such as Dunkleweizen.
